data.title: Unexpected Lullabies
data.meta_description:
Unexpected Lullabies by Alberto Rigoni, released 04 June 2024

1. Vittoria
2. Fly Me to the Moon (Cover)
3. Azzurra (feat. Alessandro Bertoni)
4. Dancing with Tears in My Eyes (Cover) feat. John Jeff Touch
5. Out of Fear
6. Veni Laetitia (feat. Alexandra Zerner)
7. Nenia
8. A Slap Lullaby (feat. Karl Clews)
9. Saga (feat. Jonas Erixon)
10. Vicky (feat. Michael Manring)
11. Strangers in the Night feat. Göran Edman
12. Ocean Traveler (in memoriam of Vitalij Kuprij)
13. Peaceful
14. Un uomo che voga

Alberto Rigoni is set to release an album called Unexpected Lullabies, a true original idea, never done before. The album contains songs that will be half sweet and half rock-metal. The album is produced and partially composed by Alberto Rigoni and dedicated to all new born babies (“There are no just tragedies in this world, life is going on!” – says Alberto)

The tracklist and musicians will be unveiled soon, but so far we can say that legendary bassist Michael Manring, keyboardists Alessandro Bertoni (Graham Bonnet Band) and Vitalij Kuprij (Artension, Trans-Siberian Orchestra) have joined the album!

Born in 1981, Alberto Rigoni is an Italian bass player, composer, producer and business laywer, internationally known for his career as a solo artist and as a member of the metal band BAD As, The Italians, Natural Born Machines, co-producer of the Vivaldi Metal Project and member of progressive rock band TwinSpirits (no more active) and bassist in Italy for famous Canadian singer Kim Bingham (ex Nelly Furtado).

Between 2008 and 2023 Alberto has released worldwide 12 solo album, spanning from progressive rock metal to fusion. His albums also featured legendary musicians such as Jeff Scott Soto (ex-Journey, Sons of Apollo, etc.), Jordan Rudess (Dream Theater) Kevin Moore (ex Dream Theater), Gavin Harrison (Porcupine Tree, King Crimson), Marco Minnemann (the Aristocrats), Göran Edman (ex Yngwie Malmsteen), Michael Manring, Nathan East, Leland Sklar and many many others.

Alberto has been featured on the cover, along with interviews, of magazine such as Bass Magazine (Japan), Bass Musician Magazine (USA), Bajos Y Bajistas (Spain), Basistas (Poland), TOP BASS (Poland).

Album Design and Artwork by Mark Barrett at https://www.elmtreecreative.co.uk


Among the various bass used one belonged to Randy Coven for the recording of Ark – Burn The Sun. Alberto searched it for years, since it’s a great fan of Randy (Rest in Peace and Power)!

Unexpected Lullabies | To be released on June 4th, 2024 via Sliptrick Records
data.text: Softly, the night wind sings, A song of love, as your cradle swings as you drift to sleep, Hey you, little dreamer, in your crib so snug, Counting sheep, getting cozy, feeling warm and hugged. A bedtime story, for the starry night. Hush now, the sky’s so vast, Dream of your playgrounds Close those bright eyes, let the music flows and dance, In this lullaby world, where love and peace reside. In this lullaby kingdom, where stars twinkle and prance. From the moon to the stars, in the clouds so high, You're the littlest dreamer, under the night sky. With a heart full of wonder, and a soul full of life, May your dreams be sweet, till the morning's first light. In this lullaby kingdom, where stars twinkle and prance… Hush now, the sky’s so vast, Dream of your playgrounds Close those bright eyes, let the music flows and dance, In this peaceful moment, where love and peace reside.
